items.title: Apple rolls out age-verification tools worldwide to comply with growing web of child safety laws
items.content: Apple complies with new age-assurance laws in the U.S. and abroad, including those that block users from downloading apps aimed at adults.

items.title: Apple might take a new approach to announcing its next products
items.content: Apple has invited the tech press to a “special Apple experience” on March 4, but it might unfold a bit differently than the company's standard press event.

items.title: Apple’s iOS 26.4 arrives in public beta with AI music playlists, video podcasts, and more
items.content: Several updates are introduced in iOS 26.4, including an AI-powered playlist-generation feature in Apple Music, support for video content in the Podcasts app, end-to-end encry

items.title: Rivian owners will soon be able to access vehicle controls using their Apple Watch
items.content: Rivian is launching a companion app that pairs with Apple Watch in the coming week.

items.title: The White House wants AI companies to cover rate hikes. Most have already said they would.
items.content: Many hyperscalers have already made public commitments to cover electricity cost increases.

items.title: The public opposition to AI infrastructure is heating up
items.content: Public backlash over the data center boom is leading to a variety of draconian policies — including bans on new construction.

items.title: All the important news from the ongoing India AI Impact Summit
items.content: India is hosting a four-day AI Summit this week that will be attended by executives from major AI labs and Big Tech, including OpenAI, Anthropic, Nvidia, Microsoft, Google, an

items.title: Microsoft’s new gaming CEO vows not to flood the ecosystem with ‘endless AI slop’
items.content: Is Microsoft's gaming division doubling down on AI?

items.title: He Hopes to Turn the Island of Nevis Into a Libertarian Paradise, With Crypto
items.content: A Bitcoin baron wants to build a libertarian paradise on the island of Nevis. Democracy is getting in the way.

items.title: Why Nvidia’s Big Profits Aren’t Lifting Markets
items.content: The chip giant at the center of the artificial intelligence boom again beat expectations. But it didn’t overcome investor jitters.

items.title: Revel, a Maker of Software for Running Hardware, Raises $150 Million
items.content: The start-up, founded by a former top SpaceX engineer, promises to help companies reduce their testing times and optimize systems.

items.title: World Economic Forum Chief Resigns Over Epstein Ties
items.content: Borge Brende, a former foreign minister of Norway, had maintained contact with the convicted sex offender.
